member.summary: Retrieves an IEnumerator object for the entire collection.

member.remarks:
Enumerators are intended to be used only to read data in the collection. Enumerators cannot be used to modify the underlying collection.
The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection.
When an enumerator is instantiated, it takes a snapshot of the current state of the collection. If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying or deleting elements, the snapshot gets out of sync and the enumerator throws an InvalidOperationException. Two enumerators instantiated from the same collection at the same time can have different snapshots of the collection.

member.returns: An IEnumerator object for the entire collection
member.remarks:
Enumerators are intended to be used only to read data in the collection. Enumerators cannot be used to modify the underlying collection.
The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection.
When an enumerator is instantiated, it takes a snapshot of the current state of the collection. If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying or deleting elements, the snapshot gets out of sync and the enumerator throws an InvalidOperationException. Two enumerators instantiated from the same collection at the same time can have different snapshots of the collection.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.SyntaxEditor.TextStatistics.FleschReadingEaseScore
member.summary: Gets the Flesch reading ease score in the range of 0 to 100, which indicates how readable the text is.
member.remarks: Scores of 90-100 are considered easily understandable by an average 5th grader. Scores of 60-70 are considered easily understandable by 8th and 9th grade students. Scores of 0-30 are best understood by college graduates.

member.name: T:ActiproSoftware.SyntaxEditor.IntelliPromptMemberList
member.summary: Provides control for the IntelliPrompt member list.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.SyntaxEditor.IntelliPromptMemberList.GetItemReflectionForAssemblyNamespacesAndTypes(System.Reflection.Assembly[],ActiproSoftware.SyntaxEditor.IntelliPromptNamespaceAndTypeFlags[],System.Collections.Specialized.StringCollection,System.Type,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Uses reflection to contruct member list items representing the namespaces in the specified objects.
member.param: The array of to examine.
The array of to use for each related .
The names of the namespaces that can populate the list. An example entry is "System".
The from which any reflected types must inherit. A can be passed in to place no restriction on reflected types.
true if the namespace name matching should be case insensitive; otherwise, false. This is useful for languages like VB.NET.
member.returns: An array of objects.

remarks.para: Ensure that you pass flags for each assembly that indicate whether to load namespaces or types (use IntelliPromptNamespaceAndTypeFlags.NamespacesAndTypes for both namespaces and types), and the access types (use IntelliPromptTypeMemberFlags.AllAccessTypes for all access types), If you do not indicate at least one flag for the categories mentioned above, the list will not populate with anything.
The number of items in the two array parameters must be exactly the same since each item in one array corresponds to the item in the same position within the other array.
The Tag property of each item will contain a string containing the full namespace name for reflected namespaces and the object for the reflected types.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.SyntaxEditor.IntelliPromptMemberList.GetItemReflectionForTypeMembers(System.Type,ActiproSoftware.SyntaxEditor.IntelliPromptTypeMemberFlags)
member.summary: Uses reflection to contruct member list items for the specified .
member.param: The to examine.
A bitmask of indicating the flags to use when adding items.
member.returns: An array of objects.

remarks.para: Ensure that you pass flags that indicate the member types (use IntelliPromptTypeMemberFlags.AllMemberTypes for all member types), the access types (use IntelliPromptTypeMemberFlags.AllAccessTypes for all access types), and whether to display IntelliPromptTypeMemberFlags.Instance or IntelliPromptTypeMemberFlags.Static members. If you do not indicate at least one flag for the categories mentioned above, the list will not populate with anything.
The Tag property of each item will contain the for the reflected type.

member.summary: Uses reflection to add items representing the namespaces in the specified objects.
member.param: The array of to examine.
The array of to use for each related .
The names of the namespaces that can populate the list. An example entry is "System".
The from which any reflected types must inherit. A can be passed in to place no restriction on reflected types.
true if the namespace name matching should be case insensitive; otherwise, false. This is useful for languages like VB.NET.

remarks.para: This method calls to retrive the items to add.

Ensure that you pass flags for each assembly that indicate whether to load namespaces or types (use IntelliPromptNamespaceAndTypeFlags.NamespacesAndTypes for both namespaces and types), and the access types (use IntelliPromptTypeMemberFlags.AllAccessTypes for all access types), If you do not indicate at least one flag for the categories mentioned above, the list will not populate with anything.
The number of items in the two array parameters must be exactly the same since each item in one array corresponds to the item in the same position within the other array.
The Tag property of each item will contain a string containing the full namespace name for reflected namespaces and the object for the reflected types.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.SyntaxEditor.IntelliPromptMemberList.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Retrieves an IEnumerator object for the entire collection.
member.returns: An IEnumerator object for the entire collection
member.remarks:
Enumerators are intended to be used only to read data in the collection. Enumerators cannot be used to modify the underlying collection.
The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection.
When an enumerator is instantiated, it takes a snapshot of the current state of the collection. If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying or deleting elements, the snapshot gets out of sync and the enumerator throws an InvalidOperationException. Two enumerators instantiated from the same collection at the same time can have different snapshots of the collection.

member.summary: Gets or sets the of non-letter/digit characters allowed to be typed while the list is displayed.
member.value: The of non-letter/digit characters allowed to be typed while the list is displayed. The default value is a that contains the underscore character.
member.remarks:
All letter and digit characters are automatically allowed by the member list and therefore do not need to added to this property. This property should only contain additional non-letter/digit characters that need to be allowed.
If a character is typed that is not a letter/digit and is not contained in this character set, the list is closed.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.SyntaxEditor.OutliningNode.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Retrieves an IEnumerator object for the entire collection.
member.returns: An IEnumerator object for the entire collection
member.remarks:
Enumerators are intended to be used only to read data in the collection. Enumerators cannot be used to modify the underlying collection.
The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection.
When an enumerator is instantiated, it takes a snapshot of the current state of the collection. If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying or deleting elements, the snapshot gets out of sync and the enumerator throws an InvalidOperationException. Two enumerators instantiated from the same collection at the same time can have different snapshots of the collection.

member.summary: Inline CSS styles will be used for highlighting. This type allows for the code block to be directly copied out of the exported document and pasted into another. Root HTML, BODY and other tags will be added to the output.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.SyntaxEditor.HtmlExportType.InlineFragment
member.summary: Inline CSS styles will be used for highlighting. This type allows for the code block to be directly copied out of the exported document and pasted into another. Root HTML, BODY and other tags will not be added to the output.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.SyntaxEditor.HtmlExportType.ClassBased
member.summary: CSS class references will be used for highlighting. This type adds a STYLE tag block to the exported HTML where CSS classes are defined. The text in the code block references these CSS classes, therefore allowing color settings to easily be altered for each highlighting style (i.e. keywords, comments, etc.). Root HTML, BODY and other tags will be added to the output.

member.name: T:ActiproSoftware.SyntaxEditor.CodeSnippetLiteral
member.summary: Represents a code snippet literal.
member.remarks: A literal is used to identify a replacement for a piece of code that is entirely contained within the code snippet, but will likely be customized after it is inserted into the code. For example, literal strings, numeric values, and some variable names should be declared as literals.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.SyntaxEditor.CodeSnippetLiteral.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the CodeSnippetLiteral class.
member.param: A unique identifier for the declaration.
The default value of the declaration, when the code snippet has been inserted.
A description of the expected value and usage of the declaration.

member.name: T:ActiproSoftware.SyntaxEditor.CodeSnippetObject
member.summary: Represents a code snippet object.
member.remarks: The Object element is used to identify an item that is required by the code snippet but is likely to be defined outside of the snippet itself. For example, Windows Forms controls, ASP.NET controls, object instances, and type instances should be declared as objects. Object declarations require that a type be specified.

member.name: T:ActiproSoftware.SyntaxEditor.IndentType
member.summary: Specifies the type of indentation to perform when the ENTER key is pressed.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.SyntaxEditor.IndentType.None
member.summary: When selected, no automatic indenting occurs when you press ENTER to move to a new line of text and the cursor is placed at the first column of the next line.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.SyntaxEditor.IndentType.Block
member.summary: When selected and you press ENTER, the new line of text is automatically indented to the same tab stop as the line preceding it.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.SyntaxEditor.IndentType.Smart
member.summary: When selected and you press ENTER, the new line of text is automatically indented based on what the current language determines the context to be. If the language does not support smart indenting then the default effect is the same as Block indent.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.SyntaxEditor.CharClass.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Retrieves an IEnumerator object for the entire collection.
member.returns: An IEnumerator object for the entire collection
member.remarks:
Enumerators are intended to be used only to read data in the collection. Enumerators cannot be used to modify the underlying collection.
The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection.
When an enumerator is instantiated, it takes a snapshot of the current state of the collection. If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying or deleting elements, the snapshot gets out of sync and the enumerator throws an InvalidOperationException. Two enumerators instantiated from the same collection at the same time can have different snapshots of the collection.

member.value: true if current line highlighting should be visible; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.SyntaxEditor.SyntaxEditor.Cursor
member.summary: Gets or sets the cursor that is displayed when the mouse pointer is over the control.
member.value: A object that represents the cursor to display when the mouse pointer is over the control.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.SyntaxEditor.SyntaxEditor.CutCopyBlankLineWhenNoSelection
member.summary: Indicates whether cut/copy operations on a blank line with no selection overwrites the clipboard with the blank line.
member.value: true if cut/copy operations on a blank line with no selection overwrites the clipboard with the blank line; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: When there is no selection in the editor and a cut or copy operation occurs, the text of the current line will be sent to the clipboard. If the text is subsequently pasted back into the editor while there is no selection, a new link will be created to insert the clipboard data and the caret will not move. Even if this property is false, cutting of blank lines will occur but the clipboard will not be changed.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.SyntaxEditor.SyntaxEditor.CutCopyDragWithHtml
member.summary: Indicates whether the cutting and copying of text to the clipboard or dragging text also copies the text in HTML format, which retains syntax highlighting.
member.value: true if the cutting and copying of text to the clipboard or dragging text also copies the text in HTML format; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Activating this feature will cause a slight delay when cutting, copying, or dragging text since the building of HTML formatted text can take time. However most likely this delay will be negligible.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.SyntaxEditor.SyntaxEditor.CutCopyDragWithRtf
member.summary: Indicates whether the cutting and copying of text to the clipboard or dragging text also copies the text in RTF format, which retains syntax highlighting.
member.value: true if the cutting and copying of text to the clipboard or dragging text also copies the text in RTF format; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Activating this feature will cause a slight delay when cutting, copying, or dragging text since the building of RTF formatted text can take time. However most likely this delay will be negligible.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.SyntaxEditor.SyntaxEditor.DefaultContextMenuEnabled
member.summary: Indicates whether a default context menu should be enabled.
member.value: true if the display of the default context menu is enabled; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: The default context menu is only displayed when this property is true and no property value is set. Set this property to false if you implement a custom context menu.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.SyntaxEditor.SyntaxEditor.UnicodeEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether Unicode character processing is enabled.
member.value: true if Unicode character processing is enabled; otherwise, false. The default is true.
member.remarks: If this property is set to true, Unicode characters will always paint correctly. If this property is set to false, Unicode characters displayed in fixed-width fonts such as Courier New will not always be measured correctly. However a setting of false will yield faster document loading/rendering results if you are sure that only ASCII characters will be used in the editor (characters 0-255).

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.SyntaxEditor.SyntaxEditor.UseDisabledRenderingForReadOnlyMode
member.summary: Indicates whether the control should be rendered using the disabled background fills when the document is in read-only mode.
member.value: true if the disabled background fills should be used when the document is in read-only mode; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: If this property is set to true, the line number margin, selection margin, and text area will use their respective disabled background fills when the document is in read-only mode. If this property is set to false, the normal background fills will be used.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.SyntaxEditor.SyntaxEditor.VerticalScrollBarHintDefaultText
member.summary: Gets or sets the default text to display as a vertical scrollbar hint.
member.value: The default text to display as a vertical scrollbar hint.
member.remarks:
This text is used in the scrollbar hint popup when the property is true and scrolling occurs.
This hint text supports the markup constructs that you can use for quick info so bold, italics, etc. are supported. Also you may specify {0} for the current line number and {1} for the total line count.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.SyntaxEditor.SyntaxEditor.WordWrap
member.summary: Indicates the type of word wrapping to perform.
member.value: A specifying the type of word wrapping to perform.
member.remarks: Use of word wrap will disable virtual space at the end of lines.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.SyntaxEditor.SyntaxEditor.WordWrapColumnIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the column at which word wrapping should be performed.
member.value: The index of the column at which word wrapping should be performed. The default is -1, which indicates to wrap at the right side of the control.

remarks.para: This property is only meant to be used with monospace (or uniform-width) fonts, such as Courier New. Word wrapping occurs at a location calculated using the property multiplied by the column index indicated by this property. This prooperty is only used when the property is set to a value other than None.
This property is zero-based. If 80 is specified as the value of this property, 80 characters will be permitted on each line.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.SyntaxEditor.SyntaxEditor.WordWrapGlyphVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to draw a word wrap glyph along the right side of lines with soft line breaks.
member.value: true if word wrap glyphs should be drawn; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: When set, this property prevents the use of the property. This property is only used when word wrap is active.

member.summary: Retrieves an IEnumerator object for the entire collection.
member.returns: An IEnumerator object for the entire collection
member.remarks:
Enumerators are intended to be used only to read data in the collection. Enumerators cannot be used to modify the underlying collection.
The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection.
When an enumerator is instantiated, it takes a snapshot of the current state of the collection. If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying or deleting elements, the snapshot gets out of sync and the enumerator throws an InvalidOperationException. Two enumerators instantiated from the same collection at the same time can have different snapshots of the collection.

Enumerators are intended to be used only to read data in the collection. Enumerators cannot be used to modify the underlying collection.
The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection.
When an enumerator is instantiated, it takes a snapshot of the current state of the collection. If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying or deleting elements, the snapshot gets out of sync and the enumerator throws an InvalidOperationException. Two enumerators instantiated from the same collection at the same time can have different snapshots of the collection.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.SyntaxEditor.Document.FooterText
member.summary: Gets or sets the footer text to append to the end of the document's when building the code for the semantic parser service.
member.value: The footer text to append to the end of the document's when building the code for the semantic parser service.
member.remarks:
The use of this property, along with , allows you use SyntaxEditor for editing "fragments" of code. The header and footer sections provide the outer code that surrounds the "fragment" being edited in the document's property.
An example is when editing a method body in a language like C#. The would contain the namespace, class, and member declaration starts. The would contain the namespace, class, and member declaration ends. The document would edit the "fragment" of statements within the header and footer and all of them would be combined for parsing by the semantic parser service. This allows for proper IntelliPrompt features while editing the "fragment".

member.remarks: The GUID is changed whenever the property is set.

member.remarks: This property simply checks the property to see if there are any characters entered into the document.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.SyntaxEditor.Document.HeaderText
member.summary: Gets or sets the header text to append to the start of the document's when building the code for the semantic parser service.
member.value: The header text to append to the start of the document's when building the code for the semantic parser service.
member.remarks:
The use of this property, along with , allows you use SyntaxEditor for editing "fragments" of code. The header and footer sections provide the outer code that surrounds the "fragment" being edited in the document's property.
An example is when editing a method body in a language like C#. The would contain the namespace, class, and member declaration starts. The would contain the namespace, class, and member declaration ends. The document would edit the "fragment" of statements within the header and footer and all of them would be combined for parsing by the semantic parser service. This allows for proper IntelliPrompt features while editing the "fragment".

remarks.para: When line modification marks are active they indicate lines upon which modifications have occurred since the last save point. The marks appear in the selection margin.
Setting this property to true will clear the undo/redo stacks since they must start empty for the line modification data to be collected properly.

member.param: The with which to compare.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.SyntaxEditor.SelectionModes.Block
member.summary: Only a rectangular portion of text is selected instead of the whole line. The selection includes all of the characters captured within the rectangle defined by the first (anchor) character and the last character in the selection.

member.name: T:ActiproSoftware.SyntaxEditor.LocationToPositionAlgorithm
member.summary: Specifies a type of location to algorithm.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.SyntaxEditor.LocationToPositionAlgorithm.BestFit
member.summary: If the location is over the left half of a character, the character's position is returned. If the location is over the right half of a character, the next character's position is returned. If the location is past the last character in a line and virtual space past the end of lines is disabled, the position of the last character in the line is returned. If the location is past the end of a document and virtual space past the end of the document is disabled, the position of the last character in the document is returned.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.SyntaxEditor.LocationToPositionAlgorithm.Block
member.summary: If the location is over a character, the character's offset is returned. If the location is past the last character in a line and virtual space past the end of lines is disabled, the position of the last character in the line is returned. If the location is past the end of a document and virtual space past the end of the document is disabled, the position of the last character in the document is returned.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.SyntaxEditor.LocationToPositionAlgorithm.Absolute
member.summary: If the location is over a character, the character's position is returned. Otherwise, -1 is returned.

member.param: Sender of the event.
A containing event data.
member.remarks: When you create a EditorViewRepaintEventHandler delegate, you identify the method that will handle the event. To associate the event with your event handler, add an instance of the delegate to the event. The event handler is called whenever the event occurs, unless you remove the delegate.

member.name: T:ActiproSoftware.SyntaxEditor.EditorViewMouseEventArgs
member.summary: Provides data for mouse events.
member.remarks: This class is used with the delegate. The property returns detailed information about what is under the mouse.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.SyntaxEditor.EditorViewMouseEventArgs.ToString
member.summary: Creates and returns a string representation of the current object.
member.returns: A string representation of the current object.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.SyntaxEditor.EditorViewMouseEventArgs.Cancel
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to cancel any processing that occurs after this event.
member.value: true if processing should be cancelled; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This property should only be used for mouse down and hover events. For mouse downs, when set to true it will cancel any selection from being started. This is useful in situations where a mouse down has special meaning to the but should not start start a selection. For mouse hovers, it will prevent any quick info tips.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.SyntaxEditor.EditorViewMouseEventArgs.HitTestResult
member.summary: Gets the that contains detailed information about what the mouse is over.
member.value: The that contains detailed information about what the mouse is over.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.SyntaxEditor.EditorViewMouseEventArgs.OldMouseOverToken
member.summary: Gets the that the mouse was over before this event fired.
member.value: The that the mouse was over before this event fired.
member.remarks: This property is only filled in for the and events.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.SyntaxEditor.EditorViewMouseEventArgs.ResetClickCount
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to reset the click count after this event.
member.value: true if the click count should be reset; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This property should only be used for mouse down events. When set to true it will reset the click count for the next time the event fires.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.SyntaxEditor.EditorViewMouseEventArgs.ToolTipTargetOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the offset at which a tooltip with should be displayed.
member.value: The offset at which a tooltip with should be displayed.
member.remarks: This property should only be used for hover events. If the mouse location should be used as the location for tooltip display, return -1.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.SyntaxEditor.EditorViewMouseEventArgs.ToolTipText
member.summary: Gets or sets the text that should be displayed in a tooltip.
member.value: The text that should be displayed in a tooltip.
member.remarks: This property should only be used for hover events. If no text should be displayed, return .

member.param: The index of the document line to go to.
The number of display lines to display above the specified line.
member.remarks: If the value is 0, the specified line will appear at the top of the view. If the value is less than 0, the specified line will be scrolled into view, however it may end up appearing anywhere within the view. If the value is greater than 0, the specified line will appear down from the top by the number of lines indicated by . A value of 2 means that the specified line will be the third display line from the top.

member.summary: Retrieves an IEnumerator object for the entire collection.
member.returns: An IEnumerator object for the entire collection
member.remarks:
Enumerators are intended to be used only to read data in the collection. Enumerators cannot be used to modify the underlying collection.
The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection.
When an enumerator is instantiated, it takes a snapshot of the current state of the collection. If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying or deleting elements, the snapshot gets out of sync and the enumerator throws an InvalidOperationException. Two enumerators instantiated from the same collection at the same time can have different snapshots of the collection.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.SyntaxEditor.Commands.MacroCommand.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Retrieves an IEnumerator object for the entire collection.
member.returns: An IEnumerator object for the entire collection
member.remarks:
Enumerators are intended to be used only to read data in the collection. Enumerators cannot be used to modify the underlying collection.
The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection.
When an enumerator is instantiated, it takes a snapshot of the current state of the collection. If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying or deleting elements, the snapshot gets out of sync and the enumerator throws an InvalidOperationException. Two enumerators instantiated from the same collection at the same time can have different snapshots of the collection.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.SyntaxEditor.Addons.Dynamic.DynamicSyntaxLanguage.LexicalStateIDType
member.summary: Gets or sets the to use when writing out lexical state ID attribute values to an XML language definition.
member.value: The to use when writing out lexical state ID attribute values to an XML language definition.
member.remarks: If simple numeric values are desired for lexical state ID output, leave this property set to . Otherwise, a constant or enumeration member in the will be looked for that matches the key of each token and has the lexical state ID value and that will be written out instead of the actual lexical state ID value.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.SyntaxEditor.Addons.Dynamic.DynamicToken.HighlightingStyle
member.summary: Gets the to use for drawing the token, if the token is aware of it.
member.value: The to use for drawing the token, if the token is aware of it.

remarks.para: Use the to set a custom highlighting style for this specific token. This is useful if you want to display user-defined functions in a separate color. If the property value is then the default for the will be used when drawing the text in the .
In some languages, the token may not be aware of what highlighting style is used to draw it. In those cases, only the language itself knows what highlighting style to use for the token.

member.name: T:ActiproSoftware.Products.SyntaxEditor.SR
member.summary: Provides access to the string resources of this assembly, also allowing for their customization.
member.remarks:
Call the method to return a resolved resource string. If a custom string has been set for a specified string resource name, it will be returned. Otherwise, the default string resource value is returned.
If any of the resource strings are customized via a call to , it is best to do so before any other classes in this assembly are referenced, such as in the application startup.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Products.SyntaxEditor.SR.ClearCustomStrings
member.summary: Removes all custom strings.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Products.SyntaxEditor.SR.ContainsCustomString(System.String)
member.summary: Returns whether a custom string is defined for the specified string resource.
member.param: The name of the resource for which to search.
member.returns: true if a custom string is defined for the specified string resource; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Products.SyntaxEditor.SR.GetCustomString(System.String)
member.summary: Returns custom string that is stored for the specified string resource, if any.
member.param: The name of the resource to get.
member.returns: The custom string that is stored for the specified string resource, if any.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Products.SyntaxEditor.SR.GetString(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the resolved value of the specified string resource.
member.param: The name of the resource to get.
member.returns: The value of the resource localized for the caller's current culture settings. If a best match is not possible, is returned.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Products.SyntaxEditor.SR.GetString(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Returns the resolved value of the specified string resource, by calling String.Format using supplied arguments.
member.param: The name of the resource to get.
The arguments to pass to String.Format.
member.returns: The value of the resource localized for the caller's current culture settings. If a best match is not possible, is returned.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Products.SyntaxEditor.SR.RemoveCustomString(System.String)
member.summary: Removes any custom string that is defined for the specified string resource.
member.param: The name of the resource to remove.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Products.SyntaxEditor.SR.SetCustomString(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sets a custom string value for the specified string resource.
member.param: The name of the resource to set.
The value of the resource to set.
